<ce:para id="p0010" view="all">Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was hydrothermally synthesized with a mixture of dysprosium nitrate, 3,4-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>qldc, oxalic acid and 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL water sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 110<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 72<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h . The molecular formula of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was determined by elemental analysis and single-crystal X-ray analysis. In IR spectrum of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (Figure <ce:bold>S1</ce:bold>), the strong and broad absorption bands in the range 3250–3510<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> are characteristic of the O–H vibration of water molecules. The spectrum also shows characteristic bands of carboxylate groups around 1550<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> assignable to the asymmetric stretch and around 1384<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> associated with the symmetric stretch . The difference of 253<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> between <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">as</ce:inf>(COO<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup>) and <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">s</ce:inf>(COO<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup>) in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> indicates that bridging carboxylates are in the <ce:italic>exo</ce:italic>-bidentate mode, as proven by the X-ray crystal structure analysis. The absence of strong bands ranging from 1690 to 1730<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> indicates that the ligands are deprotonated.</ce:para><ce:simple-para id="sp0025" view="all">Synthesis of [Dy(3,4-qldc)(ox)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (1). A mixture of 3,4-quinolinedicarboxylic (0.043<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g; 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), oxalic acid (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), Dy(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.069<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g; 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was heated to 110<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 80<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflonlined stainless-steel autoclave and was then cooled to room temperature at 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C/h<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> to obtain yellow block single crystals of 1 (yield: 75% based on Dy) Anal. Calcd for DyC<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf> H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>N O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf> (%): C, 31.46; H, 1.97; N,3.06. Found: C, 30.27; H, 2.04; N,3.21. IR frequencies (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>): 3350, 1542, 1389, 1243, 1094, 964, 890,849, 792, 664, 618, 537.</ce:simple-para>
clean_text:
Compound 1 was hydrothermally synthesized with a mixture of dysprosium nitrate, 3,4-H2qldc, oxalic acid and 20mL water sealed in a 25mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 110°C for 72h . The molecular formula of compound 1 was determined by elemental analysis and single-crystal X-ray analysis. In IR spectrum of 1 (Figure S1), the strong and broad absorption bands in the range 3250-3510cm-1 are characteristic of the O-H vibration of water molecules. The spectrum also shows characteristic bands of carboxylate groups around 1550cm-1 assignable to the asymmetric stretch and around 1384cm-1 associated with the symmetric stretch . The difference of 253cm-1 between ν as(COO-) and ν s(COO-) in 1 indicates that bridging carboxylates are in the exo-bidentate mode, as proven by the X-ray crystal structure analysis. The absence of strong bands ranging from 1690 to 1730cm-1 indicates that the ligands are deprotonated.

Synthesis of [Dy(3,4-qldc)(ox)0.5(H2O)2]n (1). A mixture of 3,4-quinolinedicarboxylic (0.043g; 0.2mmol), oxalic acid (0.2mmol), Dy(NO3)3 (0.069g; 0.2mmol), and H2O (20mL) was heated to 110°C for 80h in a 25mL Teflonlined stainless-steel autoclave and was then cooled to room temperature at 10°C/h-1 to obtain yellow block single crystals of 1 (yield: 75% based on Dy) Anal. Calcd for DyC12 H9 N O8 (%): C, 31.46; H, 1.97; N,3.06. Found: C, 30.27; H, 2.04; N,3.21. IR frequencies (KBr, cm-1): 3350, 1542, 1389, 1243, 1094, 964, 890,849, 792, 664, 618, 537.
